words.defineEn: charming in a childlike or naive way
words.defineVi: quyến rũ theo cách trẻ thơ hoặc ngây thơ

words.defineEn: characterized by effort to the point of exhaustion; especially physical effort
words.defineVi: được đặc trưng bởi nỗ lực đến mức kiệt sức; đặc biệt là nỗ lực thể chất

examples: It was very, very cumbersome.
PPE is cumbersome.
The name's cumbersome acronym H M M W V landed the truck with its nickname Humvee.
Clearly, this is a super cumbersome number to write.
This is actually a fairly straightforward one to do, but sometimes it can get quite cumbersome.
words.defineEn: ifficult to manage or handle due to its size or weight
words.defineVi: khó quản lý hoặc xử lý do kích thước hoặc trọng lượng của nó

examples: He had this powerful woman by his side, but it grew tiresome for him.
I also like that CHAPPiE's hero does battle with the tiresome roles that robots have generally been relegated to by Hollywood.
Being a caregiver can be very stressful and tiresome.
And why did it grow tiresome for him?
And it just gets so tiresome talking about the same thing over and over, and you just want a break from having to be the activist that you, kind of, rolled into.
words.defineEn: so lacking in interest as to cause mental weariness
words.defineVi: quá thiếu quan tâm đến mức gây ra sự mệt mỏi về tinh thần

examples: If anything, the fact that we’re uniquely meddlesome animals has scientists thinking we’ll probably bring about our own demise.
words.defineEn: intrusive in a meddling or offensive manner
words.defineVi: xâm nhập theo cách can thiệp hoặc gây khó chịu

words.defineEn: unpleasantly and excessively suave or ingratiating in manner or speech
words.defineVi: một cách khó chịu và quá ngọt ngào hoặc ăn nhập trong cách thức hoặc lời nói

words.defineEn: gracefully thin and bending and moving with ease
words.defineVi: duyên dáng mỏng và uốn cong và di chuyển một cách dễ dàng

examples: For instance, travelers discovered that people across Asia didn’t seem as quarrelsome as Europeans. 12.

And it just gets so tiresome talking about the same thing over and over, and you just want a break from having to be the activist that you, kind of, rolled into.
words.defineEn: so lacking in interest as to cause mental weariness

examples: First, Putin perceives us as weak, feckless, indecisive, slow to respond.
He goes with the corrupt, feckless Republican establishment instincts for the first couple of months of his presidency, and it backfires.
words.defineEn: of no determination, competence, or strength
words.defineVi: không có quyết tâm, năng lực hay sức mạnh

words.defineEn: moving in a way that is not attractive or smooth
words.defineVi: di chuyển theo cách không hấp dẫn hoặc trơn tru

examples: The men became gaunt and listless, and showed a decrease in strength, heart rate, and body temperature.
We do not deserve to live this hard, listless and awful life.
words.defineEn: marked by low spirits; showing no enthusiasm
words.defineVi: đánh dấu bằng tinh thần thấp; không thể hiện sự nhiệt tình

words.defineEn: showing no ambition and disinterested in achieving success
words.defineVi: không có tham vọng và không quan tâm đến việc đạt được thành công

examples: There might be, like Don Jr., some hapless collusion.
And this ultimately means that the hapless cricket goes for a swim whether it wants to or not.
When a fish swims over the wrong patch of sand, the worm lunges up from its burrow, grabs on with its strong, sharp pincers, and drags its hapless meal down.

Especially at the beginning of the war, there was a lot of offensive movement, especially in the initial German strikes, especially on the Eastern Front, the Germans were pretty successful against the Russians, who had a large but pretty hapless army.

Once the hapless square comes to terms with the third dimension, he begs his host to help him visit the fourth and higher dimensions, but the sphere bristles at the mere suggestion of dimensions higher than three and exiles the square back to Flatland.
words.defineVi: xứng đáng hoặc kích động thương hại

examples: When the ship started sinking, the passengers panicked and it was every man for himself and the devil take the hindmost.
words.defineVi: nằm xa nhất về phía sau

examples: The uppermost track will always take precedence.
That is very much uppermost in our minds.
During each pass, Juno gets as close as about 4,200 kilometers above the uppermost gases.
They suggest Jupiter has three different cloud layers: The uppermost has a lot of ammonia, and below that it’s ammonia and sulfur.

So, he's going to have to walk a very difficult line, and he's going to have to do to really not being prepared, in the sense that this is not an administration that went into this situation expecting the Palestinian-Israeli conflict to be uppermost on its agenda.
words.defineEn: at or nearest to the top
words.defineVi: tại hoặc gần nhất với đỉnh

examples: We did our utmost to help.
I was trying my utmost to remain positive and not talk about cancer.
But I will always take the utmost precaution anyway.
To him, that was probably the utmost goal in a lot of ways.
And I say this with the utmost of love and respect for you, man.
words.defineEn: of the greatest possible degree or extent or intensity
words.defineVi: ở mức độ hoặc mức độ hoặc cường độ lớn nhất có thể

examples: And so, first and foremost, that statement is false.
First and foremost, we are safety professionals.
And, first and foremost, this measure is historic in nature.
Her account of her father’s reign is historians’ foremost source for Byzantine political history at the time of the first crusade.
My next guest tonight is the country's foremost expert on Halloween gadgets.
words.defineEn: having the leading or primary position in terms of significance, importance, or rank
words.defineVi: có vị trí hàng đầu hoặc chính về ý nghĩa, tầm quan trọng hoặc thứ hạng
